NATHANIEL: Don’t know about that. I was terribly afraid when that thing was... inside you. Using your voice.
PHOEBE: I wasn’t scared, exactly. It was as though I were asleep, and yet awake at the same time. I knew what was going on, what was being said, but everything was at one remove, as though I was watching a dream unfolding before my eyes.
NATHANIEL: (KISSES HER FOREHEAD) Sounds ghastly. But it’s all over [now.]
DOCTOR WHO: MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 90
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: AS HE SPEAKS WE HEAR A SCUTTLING, FROM CORRIDOR OUTSIDE — AS OF SMALL, WOODEN FEET)
PHOEBE: Shhh.
NATHANIEL: (WHISPERING) What is it?
PHOEBE: (QUIETLY) I’m sure I heard something outside —
PHOEBE: Yes, there it is again. (HOPEFULLY) A rat, perhaps?
NATHANTEL: (RISING) If we do have an intruder I’1l soon flush him out. You wait here, my dear. (AS HE EXITS: )
PHOEBE: Father, no!
DOCTOR WHO: MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 91
HANNAH: All alone, Mr Tremayne?
EDWIN: Yes, the Whitlocks and my son are upstairs, and Silver Crow has accompanied the Doctor and his friend Nyssa into the woods.
HANNAH: The woods? Whatever for?
EDWIN: (CYNICALLY) Apparently the Doctor has a machine that travels in time and space, and believes that the moonflesh creature can use it to make its escape.
HANNAH: (ASTONISHED) The Doctor has a what? But... but this is wonderful!
EDWIN: I’m glad that you think so. You do realise that the grounds are crawling with these creatures now? And that we’re all in the most appalling danger, thanks to you?
HANNAH: Even so, Mr Tremayne.. creatures from beyond the stars, a
HANNAH: machine that travels in time and space. It’s all terribly thrilling. It vindicates the beliefs I’ve clung to all my life.
EDWIN: The only thing I’m interested in clinging to is life itself. Have you had any further thoughts about my offer?
HANNAH: Yes. (HESITATES) The carriage is ready.
EDWIN: You mean, you accept?
HANNAH: For a thousand pounds I’1l take you away from here. But I aim to return as soon as I’ve fulfilled my side of the bargain.
EDWIN: What you decide to do once you’ve delivered me to a hospital doesn’t concern me in the slightest. When can we leave?
DOCTOR WHO: MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 92
HANNAH: I suppose we may not get a better opportunity than now.
EDWIN: Help me up, then. (FX: AS SHE MOVES TO HELP HIM RISE FROM THE
EDWIN: CHAISE-LONGUE) You’1l have to on, woman! Quickly!
EDWIN: HANNAH/EDWIN:
CUT TO: Support me on my left side. Come
DOCTOR WHO: MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 93
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: PHOEBE CLOSES BEDROOM DOOR, OFF, THEN TAKES A FEW STEPS
ONTO: LANDING)
PHOEBE: Father? Father..? Where are y- (SEES SOMETHING SURPRISING!) Oh! But that’s —
NATHANIEL: (APPROACHING SWIFTLY DOWN STAIRWAY) Phoebe, my dear, I told you to rest!
PHOEBE: How can I rest? Father, look!
NATHANIEL: (BEMUSED) Look where?
PHOEBE: Above the stairwell! Tunka, Ptesan Wi, Iktomi the spider — they’ve all gone!
NATHANIEL: Silver Crow’s statuettes, eh? (DOUBTFUL) Perhaps he’s taken ‘em down to dust...
PHOEBE: Don’t you remember, what the Doctor said? That the energy- creatures can animate both organic and inorganic material alike?
NATHANIEL: (SCOFFS) What’re you saying? That Crow’s wooden men have come to life?
NATHANIEL: (FX: FROM BEHIND THE DOOR OF THE NEXT ROOM, ALONG THE CORRIDOR, THE SOUND OF SCUTTLING)
PHOEBE: (FRIGHTENED GASP) That came from Silver Crow’s room!
NATHANIEL: Funny. Sounded like something — scuttling...
PHOEBE: Scuttling, yes. Like Iktomi, the spider-god!
DOCTOR WHO: MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 94
SILVER CROW: (AHEAD, CALLING BACK) Into the trees! It is not much further
SILVER CROW: now!
DOCTOR: (TO NYSSA, ON SAME HORSE) Hear that, Vatuus? Nearly there! How are you enjoying the ride?
DOCTOR: NYSSA/ALIEN: (FX: DEEP, AS PHOEBE’S POSSESSION) I am finding it... exhilarating, Doctor.
DOCTOR: Well, corporeal life isn’t without its pleasures.
DOCTOR WHO: MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 95
NATHANIEL: (SOTTO) Don’t worry, Phoebe, my dear. Even if those blighters have occupied Silver Crow’s figures, I doubt they’1l withstand a blast or two from this little beauty.
PHOEBE: (SOTTO) But bullets won’t harm them, Father!
NATHANIEL: (SOTTO) Maybe not, but I can rattle ’em enough to make ‘em beat a hasty retreat. Both times I fired on that Vatuus fellow he was off like a frightened fox. Now, let’s see if we can’t catch these chaps unawares —
NATHANIEL: (SOTTO) Doorknob could use a drop of oil, what?
PHOEBE: (SOTTO) Shh.
PHOEBE: (SOTTO) Can you see anything?
NATHANIEL: (SOTTO) Curtains are closed. Wait here. I’1ll scoot across and open ‘em.
PHOEBE: (SOTTO) Don’t, Father. It’s a trap, I’m sure of it.
NATHANIEL: (SOTTO) If it is, at least it’ll draw the blighters out.
NATHANIEL: (FX: HE TAKES A COUPLE OF STEPS INTO THE ROOM. FROM THE CORNER, SCUTTLING MOVEMENT )
PHOEBE: There! Under the bed! Iktomi!
NATHANIEL: (LEVELLING GUN) Right, you beggar —
PHOEBE: Father, no! Behind you! Shadows behind you!
DOCTOR WHO: MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 96
NATHANIEL: What-?
PHOEBE: Tunka, Ptesan-Wi! No-!!!
PHOEBE: (FX: SIMULTANEOUSLY, WITH A SERIES OF HIDEOUS, HIGH-PITCHED CRIES, 3 x WOODEN FIGURES/ENERGY-CREATURES ATTACK! CROSS TO:)
DOCTOR WHO: MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 97
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: DISTANT CRIES CONTINUE FROM FLOOR ABOVE — THEN 2 x
SHOTGUN: BLASTS IN QUICK SUCCESSION)
HANNAH: (STOPPING, SAGGING UNDER EDWIN’S WEIGHT) My God! What’s happening up there?
EDWIN: (GASPING OUT THE WORDS) I assume Vatuus’s assassins have breached the defences.
HANNAH: We must help them.
EDWIN: Don’t be ridiculous. They’re beyond help. We have to save ourselves.
HANNAH: But your son-
EDWIN: (VEHEMENTLY) Don’t argue, woman! We need to get out of here! Come on! Quickly!
DOCTOR WHO: MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 98
DOCTOR: (USHERING POSSESSED NYSSA IN) Here we are, Vatuus.
SILVER CROW: (JUST OUTSIDE) Doctor, should I bring the horses again?
DOCTOR: (CALLING BACK) That won’t be necessary, Silver Crow. (MORE TO VATUUS) I can be back within moments of dropping Vatuus off, I hope.
DOCTOR: NYSSA/ALIEN: (LOOKING AROUND) This TARDIS of yours. It travels that fast?
DOCTOR: (CROSSING TO CONSOLE) Faster than the speed of thought.
DOCTOR: NYSSA/ALIEN: ‘Thought’? This vessel is sentient?
DOCTOR: She has telepathic circuits, yes —
DOCTOR: NYSSA/ALIEN: (EXCITED) Then it has a mind of its own!
DOCTOR: Frequently. (FX: SETTING BUTTONS) So — where to? Can’t say I much like acting as a chauffeur, but under the [circumstances...]
DOCTOR: NYSSA/ALIEN: (INTERRUPTING) Where are these ‘telepathic circuits’?
DOCTOR: Oh! They’re, er, right under the central column —
DOCTOR: NYSSA/ALIEN: Then that is all I need to know!
DOCTOR: Vatuus. Surely you can’t be thinking of — well, possessing the TARDIS?
DOCTOR WHO: MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 99
DOCTOR WHO: NYSSA/ALIEN:
DOCTOR WHO: Wherever you take me, my pursuers will follow. But with this TARDIS of yours, I might evade them for all eternity! (REACHING FORWARD, OVER CONSOLE) All I have to do is reach out into this circuit, and —
DOCTOR: (STAYING HER HAND) No, Vatuus!
DOCTOR: NYSSA/ALIEN: (PUSHING HIM OFF, VERY STRONG) Unhand me, Doctor!
DOCTOR: (REELING) Oof! Please, Vatuus, you mustn’t touch that circuit!
DOCTOR: NYSSA/ALIEN: Why?
DOCTOR: Well, because you’re still in Nyssa’s body. The power running through the central column will electrocute her!
DOCTOR: NYSSA/ALIEN: So? I can always find some other corporeal entity to possess, once I can travel anywhere in all of time and space.
DOCTOR: Vatuus, no-!
DOCTOR: NYSSA/ALIEN: (REACHING OUT) All I have to is — connect.
DOCTOR: (FX: SPARK OF ENERGY. ELECTRICAL BANG! NYSSA’S BODY THUMPS TO FLOOR. DOCTOR RUSHES OVER)
DOCTOR: (SHAKING HER) Nyssa? Nyssa? Are you alright-?
NYSSA: (SUDDEN INTAKE OF BREATH) Oh! Doctor! Doctor, it was horrible. That thing inside my mind — so much avarice, so much anger...
DOCTOR: Yes, your latent telepathy will have picked up emotions hidden from a mere human mind. But it’s alright, it’s gone now. Here, let me help you up.
NYSSA: (HELPED UP) Thank you. So you did as it asked? Took it to another world?
DOCTOR WHO: MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 100
DOCTOR: No, of course not. (CROSSING TO CONSOLE) I had my suspicions, so I tempted friend Vatuus with the TARDIS’ telepathic circuits. That was when he showed his true colours.
NYSSA: So where is he now?
DOCTOR: Earthed into a harmless conduit. (FX: OPENS TARDIS DOORS) The
TARDIS: ought to be able to hold him there, for a while at least.
SILVER CROW: (ENTERING FROM OUTSIDE) Doctor? Why have you not left?
DOCTOR: Change of plan, Silver Crow. (FX: SPARKING, CRACKLING FROM
CONSOLE BEGINS UNDER: ) Turned out that Vatuus wasn’t all he pretended to be —
NYSSA: Doctor, the console!
DOCTOR: Oh no. (TO ENERGY BALL) Vatuus, this is futile. You can’t possess the TARDIS, you can’t possess me, and Nyssa senses exactly what you’re up to —
NYSSA: It isn’t us he’s going for!
SILVER CROW: (SHOUTING OVER THIS) No! You shall not have my mind, moon- Spirit! I shall fight you!
SILVER CROW: (FX: AS WHEN THE CREATURE TRIED TO POSSESS THE DOCTOR,
SPARKING: LIKE IT’S BEING REPELLED)
DOCTOR: (SHOUTING OVER THIS) That’s right, Silver Crow! Don’t let it
DOCTOR: in!
DOCTOR WHO: MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 101
NYSSA: Doctor! It’s heading out of the doors!
NYSSA: (FX: CRACKLING. ONE OF THE HORSES BEGINS TO SNORT AND STAMP AND WHINNY IN AGITATION)
SILVER CROW: (RUSHING TO DOORS) It is taking one of the horses!
DOCTOR: (JUST BEHIND) Oh no.
DOCTOR: (FX: HISSING/CRACKLING/WHINNYING BECOMES MORE FRENZIED. SUDDENLY THE BRIDLE TETHERING HORSE SNAPS... AND IT GALLOPS
AWAY: )
SILVER CROW: The beast is free!
NYSSA: Doctor, what do we do now?
DOCTOR WHO: MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 102
DOCTOR: Right outside the drawing room. Not bad at all.
SILVER CROW: (FOLLOWING) But why are we back here, when the moon-spirits are loose?
NYSSA: (FOLLOWING) We can keep everyone safe inside the TARDIS — can’t we, Doctor?
DOCTOR: (FX: PULLS TARDIS DOOR CLOSED) Yes, I should be able to rig up a field to repel these creatures, at least until we’re able to sort this situation out.
NYSSA: (HUSHED) It’s very quiet.
DOCTOR: It does seem a bit sepulchral.
SILVER CROW: Let us try the drawing room first.
DOCTOR: (REACHING FOR DOORKNOB...) It seems as good a place as any.
DOCTOR: (FX: TURNS DOORKNOB; FOLLOW HIM TWO STEPS INTO DRAWING ROOM.
CRACKLING: FIRE. HISSING OF 3 x ALIENS. CLICK OF 3 x RIFLES
BEING: PRIMED)
BEING: PHOEBE/ALIEN: It is the alien Doctor!
BEING: HECTOR/ALIEN: At last!
BEING: NATHANIEL/ALIEN: We have been waiting for you!
BEING: END OF PART THREE
DOCTOR WHO: MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 103

elements.text: PART FOUR
REPRISE:
(HUSHED) It’s very quiet.
It does seem a bit sepulchral.
Let us try the drawing room first.
(REACHING FOR DOORKNOB...) It seems as good a place as any.
(FX: TURNS DOORKNOB; FOLLOW HIM TWO STEPS INTO DRAWING ROOM.
FIRE. HISSING OF 3 x ALIENS. CLICK OF 3 x RIFLES
PRIMED)
NB: ALL VOICES DEEPER/TREATED AS BEFORE
PHOEBE/ALIEN: Tt is the alien Doctor!
HECTOR/ALIEN: At last!
NATHANIEL/ALIEN: We have been waiting for you!
48. INT. DRAWING ROOM [CONTINUED]
/ALIEN: We mean you no harm, Doctor.
I think I speak for all of us when I say that we’d find that a little more reassuring if we didn’t have several guns pointing at our heads.
NATHANIEL/ALIEN: The guns are merely a precaution, to discourage your party from reacting adversely to our presence.
Well, consider us discouraged.
(TO ALIENS) Please-?
MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 104
NATHANIEL/ALIEN: Lower arms, my brothers.
PAUSE AS THEY DO SO
Thank you. That’s much better.
(MUTTERING) Didn’t Vatuus say that his pursuers were creatures of instinct and savagery, who would kill without compunction?
He did. (RAISING HIS VOICE) But these people seem entirely civilised, don’t you think?
Other than they are using our friends as their puppets.
HECTOR/ALIEN: We inhabit these natives merely to subdue their violent urges — and in order to communicate with you.
Miss Phoebe has no violent urges. Nor does this Hector.
Besides, you only need one mouthpiece. So why not release them, apart from Nathaniel? As a show of good faith.
FX: THE ALIENS CRACKLE AT EACH OTHER FOR A MOMENT, THEN:
NATHANIEL/ALIEN: We accede.
(FX: FADE UP HISSING/CRACKLING OF THE ENERGY-CREATURES AS THEY RISE FROM THE BODIES OF PHOEBE AND HECTOR)
(DARTING FORWARD) Quick, catch them before they fall —
(DITTO) Good idea.
/HECTOR:
GASP, REEL, COLLAPSE INTO ARMS OF DOCTOR AND SILVER CROW
(CATCHING HER) It’s alright, Phoebe, I’ve got you.
Doctor-?
MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 105
(GROGGY) I say, what a peculiar experience.
You are safe now.
NATHANIEL/ALIEN: Now, Doctor: where is Vatuus? We know from the minds of our human hosts that he lied to you to procure your assistance.
Outside, somewhere. I’m afraid he slipped through our fingers, rather.
NATHANIEL/ALIEN: That is unfortunate.
Who exactly is he?
NATHANIEL/ALIEN: A rogue element, responsible for the cessation of numerous energy-links within the Cluster.
A murderer, you mean?
So who are you chaps? The police?
NATHANIEL/ALIEN:
We are... trackers. Our task is to follow Vatuus’s trail and capture him, whereupon he will be temporarily re-absorbed and returned to the Prime Cluster.
So if it hadn’t been for Ms Bartholomew’s interference, Vatuus might have escaped justice?
NATHANIEL/ALIEN: I do not understand.
Of course! It was Hannah — I mean, Ms Bartholomew — who brought Vatuus back to life, by scraping the ‘moonflesh’ with her knife!
Thereby reactivating Vatuus’ trail, exactly!
MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 106
NATHANIEL/ALIEN: What we do not understand is how Vatuus hid himself from us for so long.
You mean — it wasn’t his choice to become moonflesh?
That isn’t something your people can do?
NATHANIEL/ALIEN: No.
Now that’s interesting. It suggests that Vatuus was forced into a state of dormancy by an outside factor.
What sort of factor?
A factor like you, Silver Crow.
(SURPRISED) Me?
Yes. Or more specifically by your state of mind when you first encountered Vatuus. Didn’t you say that you fell into a trance during the ghost dance, and woke with the moonflesh in your hand?
That is how it was.

In which case, isn’t it reasonable to assume that Vatuus fell to Earth — or was drawn here, even, by Silver Crow’s detached state of consciousness — and attempted to possess him, to use him as a physical host?
No, I’m quite lost.
Ssh!

But Silver Crow’s subconscious — his dreaming mind — was somehow able to better Vatuus, perhaps by feeding on his Cluster energy? As a result of which Vatuus was reduced to... well, to a harmless rock.
MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 107
Until Hannah came along, and, well, shocked him back to life?
FX: CONFERRING CRACKLES AGAIN
NATHANIEL/ALIEN: This is... feasible.
May I ask a question, Doctor?
Certainly.
Where is Ms Bartholomew?
Come to think of it, where’s my father?
MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 108
49. EXT. GROUNDS OF WHITLOCK MANOR — ROAD
FX: RATTLE OF HORSE-DRAWN CARRIAGE ON UNEVEN ROAD. A JOLT
(DRIVING, CALLING BACK) I apologise for the bumpy ride, Mr Tremayne!
FX: EDWIN ROLLS DOWN WINDOW
(CALLING OUT) Just get a move on, [woman-! ]
(FX: OFF, TRUMPETING OF AN ELEPHANT, STOMPING INTO VIEW
Oh, my life!
What is it?
Elephant, on the road ahead! (TO HORSES; PULLING ON REINS) Whoa! Whoa there!
FX: CARRIAGE SLOWS TO A HALT
Keep going, woman! Blasted thing’ll soon move out of the way.
It’s an elephant, you stupid man! We’1ll just have to wait.
FX: ELEPHANT SNORTS — IT’S ABOUT 50 FEET AWAY
What’s it doing, just staring at us? (TO ELEPHANT) Go on, shoo! Shoo! (TO HANNAH) You’d think the damn thing had parked there deliberately!
(REALISATION) To stop us leaving. Oh, no...
What’s that?
One of the moonflesh creatures! It’s inside the elephant! It
must be!
FX: SOFT CRACKLING FROM ELEPHANT
MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 109
My God, it’s hide’s rippling, just like the gorilla. (URGENTLY) About face, woman! Get us away from here!
(FX: TRYING TO MARSHAL HORSES) The path is too narrow. There’s no room to turn!
FX: ELEPHANT, STAMPS, BELLOWS...
Hurry, woman. It’s about to [charge! ]
FX: ELEPHANT CHARGES. HORSES WHINNY AND STAMP IN TERROR...
Too late!
(YELLS IN TERROR) Ms Bartholomew! Do something!
I’m sorry, you’re on your own. (JUMPS FROM CARRIAGE)
FX: ANOTHER BELLOW FROM CHARGING ELEPHANT
But you can’t! You can’t just abandon me here!
Like we abandoned the others? Like you abandoned your son?
FX: SHE RUNS INTO WOODLAND
(FX: BANGING ON DOOR) What are you doing? Ms Bartholomew, come back! Don’t leave me! You can’t leave me! You [can’t!!!]
(FX: ELEPHANT REACHES THE CARRIAGE AND TRAMPLES IT TO
HIDEOUS, DRAWN-OUT, DYING SCREAM
MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 110
50. INT. DRAWING ROOM
FX: 3 x ALIENS CRACKLING SOFTLY THROUGHOUT. DOOR OPENS
(ENTERING, SLIGHTLY OUT OF BREATH) It is as we feared. The carriage is gone.
(INDIGNANT) So Father and Ms Bartholomew have run out on us. I can’t say I’m entirely surprised in Father’s case.
He seemed like a very selfish man.
Ms Bartholomew, though...
Oh, I expect she was paid handsomely for her help.
(BITTERLY) Well, Father did always say that everyone had their price. I can only apologise to you all for his actions.
It is not you who has abandoned us, Hector.
One cannot blame Mr Tremayne for wanting to leave, given the condition of his leg.
I only hope that Vatuus doesn’t catch up with them.
Yes, this Vatuus fellow. Now you alien types have caught up with him, can’t you just ‘reabsorb’ him or whatever it is you do, and leave us all in peace?
NATHANIEL/ALIEN: It is not as simple as that.
No, I thought it might not be.
NATHANIEL/ALIEN:
We here now are merely trackers. But if we cannot arrest Vatuus soon, a Cluster entire will descend on this world, to assist us.
MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 111
How many of you in a Cluster?
FX: CONFERRING CRACKLES
NATHANIEL/ALIEN: In your terms: one billion.
A billion-?! I don’t even know how many that is.
A thousand million of these beings, capable of possessing every mind in this hemisphere.
(TO ALIENS) ‘Soon’, you said. How soon? When exactly will this Cluster arrive?
FX: CONFERRING CRACKLES
NATHANIEL/ALIEN: Dawn.
Dawn-?!?
That gives us three hours to discover how to make Vatuus dormant again, before the rest of these aliens arrive.
Yes, and there’s only one way we’re going to find that out.
Well, how?
Oh, I think that Silver Crow knows the answer to that.
I believe I do, Doctor. You wish to recreate the ghost dance, do you not?
In the most exact possible detail, yes!
MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 112
51. EXT. WOODLAND — CLEARING (BY FIRE
(FX: FADE UP. CRACKLING CAMPFIRE. SILVER CROW DROPS A HANDFUL OF HERBS ON IT — SIZZLE OF FLAME)
(COUGHING ON SMOKE) Interesting odour.

It is a blend of harmless herbs, a secret passed down through generation after generation of my people. Close your eyes, allow the smoke to fill your senses and empty your mind of thoughts. Only when we are free of worldly concerns can we join the ghost dance.
(FX: ANOTHER SIZZLE AS MORE HERBS ARE DROPPED INTO THE FLAMES.
MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 113
52. EXT. WOODLAND — CLEARING (FURTHER AWAY) [CONTINUOUS]
I still don’t quite understand what this ghost dance is supposed to achieve.
Silver Crow is attempting to re-enter the state of consciousness he was in when he first encountered Vatuus and reduced him to a crystalline form — only this time he’s taking the Doctor with him.
You make it sound as if they’re setting out on a journey.
They are, in a way. A journey of the mind.
CROSS BACK TO:
MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 114
53. EXT. WOODLAND — CLEARING (BY FIRE) [CONTINUOUS]
(FX: FIRE. SILVER CROW BEGINS BEATING A SIMPLE RHYTHM ON A TOM-TOM DRUM WITH HIS HANDS. PACE BECOMING STEADILY FASTER AS HE CHANTS UNDER HIS BREATH THE FOLLOWING: )

Come to me on the wings of dawn Power of the flame, come to me/ Come to me, bring sparks of life. Power of the ocean, come to me/ Come to me, swim through my dreams. [Power of the darkness, come to me/ Come to me, oh Earthen flesh.
Power of the spiral, come to me/ Come to weave me in your web.
Power of the Spirits, come to me/ Come to me from your silent realms. ]
(NB: REPEAT AS NECESSARY UNDER SUBSEQUENT SCENE, AS WE CROSS
MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 115
54. EXT. WOODLAND — CLEARING (FURTHER AWAY) [CONTINUOUS]
FX: PHOEBE AND NATHANIEL WALKING UP
Oh! — Have they started already?
Without us?
Phoebe, Mr Whitlock. Yes, I think it’s beginning.
That is you, isn’t it, Mr Whitlock?

Those creatures seemed to think I’d be needed. Well, me and me guns alike. Still not entirely sure I understand why. Even less sure why Phoebe and Nyssa are out here with us, rather being than locked safely in the house.
We’re here because once the Doctor and Silver Crow enter the ghost dance they’1l be vulnerable to physical attack —
What — from this Vatuus, you mean?
Yes, and the animals in your woods.
Suppose Silver Crow might as well be banging a dinner gong as those tom-tom drums of his.
It’s all part of the ritual. The ghost dance has to take place in the open air — among the spirits, as it were.
It’s better if there are the four of us here to defend them, rather than just two — especially since Mr Whitlock is still recovering from his possession.
Oh, I’m as right as rain now, my dear. It’s an odd experience, rather like dreaming whilst awake — but not entirely unpleasant.
Phoebe — you won’t really be shooting that rifle, will you?
MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 116
Oh, Hector. Father taught me to shoot when I was just a little girl;
Yes, and she’s got an eye for it, too.
Oh, crumbs!
Hush now, everyone. I think something’s about to happen.
(FX: CROSS BACK TO CROW’S CHANTING, VERY FAST BY NOW, LOOPING
ITSELF, BUILDING TO A FRANTIC CRESCENDO — THEN CUT SUDDENLY TO SILENCE)
MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 117
55. EXT. PLAINS OF MONTANA (DREAMSCAPE
(FX: REVERSE ECHO IN) Doctor! .. Doctor!
(COMING TO, DAZZLED) Oh! Could you dim the lights a little?
It is the sun, Doctor.
The sun? (SNAPS AWAKE) Where are we? No, don’t tell me. Judging by those mountain ranges and this dry desert plain — not to mention the heat — I’d say... Montana?
It is my home, Doctor — or my memory of it, at least.
Of course. The dreamscape.
FX: SOFT SNORTS OF A NEARBY PAIR OF HORSES
(WALKING TO HORSES) See, our horses are here.
(FOLLOWING) But to take us where, I wonder?
FX: DISTANT THUNDERING OF A PASSING HERD OF BUFFALO
Down in the valley, Doctor. Look!
A herd of white buffalo. What does it mean?
They are sacred to my people. Their purpose is to act as guides through unknown territory. (FX: MOUNTING HORSE — EFFORT) Quickly, mount up.
(FX: MOUNTING HORSE — EFFORT) We have to follow them?
They will take us to where we need to go.
And where’s that?
MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 118
Our destination will remain a mystery until we reach it. (GEEING HORSE) Yaa!
FX: AS HE GALLOPS OFF OVER HARD, DRY GROUND
I had a feeling you might say that. (TO HORSE) Ya! Ya!
FX: DOCTOR'S HORSE FOLLOWS
MOONFLESH by Mark Morris (FINAL) 119
56. EXT. WOODLAND — BY FIRE
(HUSHED) They’re just sat there, staring into space. Do you think we should-?
No. It could be dangerous, to pull them out of the dance.
